Constructor Detail

TwitterUtils

public TwitterUtils()
Method Detail

link

public static void link(Activity context,
                        SocializeAuthListener listener)
Links the current user to their Twitter account. This method will request authentication from the user if their credentials are not currently known.

Parameters:
context - The current activity.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

link

public static void link(Activity context,
                        String token,
                        String secret,
                        SocializeAuthListener listener)
Links the current user to their Twitter account using an existing Twitter oAuth token and secret.

Parameters:
context - The current activity.
token - The user's Twitter token.
secret - The user's Twitter token secret.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

unlink

public static void unlink(Context context)
Removes the association between a user and their Twitter account. This method executes synchronously.

Parameters:
context - The current activity.

isLinked

public static boolean isLinked(Context context)
Determines if the current user is linked to a Twitter account.

Parameters:
context - The current activity.
Returns:
True if the current user is already linked to a Twitter account. False otherwise.

isAvailable

public static boolean isAvailable(Context context)
Determines if Twitter has been configured correctly for the application.

Parameters:
context - The current activity.
Returns:
True if Twitter is configured correctly. False otherwise.

setCredentials

public static void setCredentials(Context context,
                                  String consumerKey,
                                  String consumerSecret)
Sets the Twitter App credentials for the application. This sets the same configuration properties as twitter.consumer.key and twitter.consumer.secret

Parameters:
context - The current context.
consumerKey - The Twitter App Consumer Key
consumerSecret - The Twitter App Consumer Secret

getAccessToken

public static String getAccessToken(Context context)
Returns the user's Twitter access token.

Parameters:
context - The current context.
Returns:
The user's Twitter access token or null if the user is not linked to a Twitter account.

getTokenSecret

public static String getTokenSecret(Context context)
Returns the user's Twitter access token secret.

Parameters:
context - The current context.
Returns:
The user's Twitter access token secret or null if the user is not linked to a Twitter account.

tweetEntity

public static void tweetEntity(Activity context,
                               Entity entity,
                               String text,
                               SocialNetworkShareListener listener)
"Tweets" an entity. A "share" event will be recorded in Socialize and the entity URL generated by Socialize will be posted to the user's Twitter feed. If the user is not currently linked to a Twitter account they will be prompted to authenticate.

Parameters:
context - The current activity.
entity - The entity to be tweeted.
text - The text to be posted along with the tweet.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

post

public static void post(Activity context,
                        String resource,
                        Map<String,Object> postData,
                        SocialNetworkPostListener listener)
Performs a simple HTTP POST to the Twitter resource endpoint specified. If the user is not currently linked to a Twitter account they will be prompted to authenticate.

Parameters:
context - The current Activity.
resource - The resource to be called. NOTE: This should NOT include the full url (e.g. http://api.twitter.com) but just the resource. Changing the full URL endpoint can be done via the SocialNetworkPostListener onBeforePost callback.
postData - The parameters to be posted.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

get

public static void get(Activity context,
                       String resource,
                       Map<String,Object> params,
                       SocialNetworkPostListener listener)
Performs a simple HTTP GET to the Twitter resource endpoint specified. If the user is not currently linked to a Twitter account they will be prompted to authenticate.

Parameters:
context - The current Activity.
resource - The resource to be called. NOTE: This should NOT include the full url (e.g. http://api.twitter.com) but just the resource. Changing the full URL endpoint can be done via the SocialNetworkPostListener onBeforePost callback.
params - The parameters to be posted.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

tweet

public static void tweet(Activity context,
                         Tweet tweet,
                         SocialNetworkListener listener)
Performs a simple "tweet". If the user is not currently linked to a Twitter account they will be prompted to authenticate.

Parameters:
context - The current Activity.
tweet - The Tweet to be tweeted.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

tweetPhoto

public static void tweetPhoto(Activity context,
                              PhotoTweet photo,
                              SocialNetworkPostListener listener)
Publishes a photo to a user's Twitter feed. If the user is not currently linked to a Twitter account they will be prompted to authenticate.

Parameters:
context - The current Activity.
photo - The image to be tweeted.
listener - A listener to handle the result.

getImageForPost

public static byte[] getImageForPost(Activity context,
                                     Uri imagePath)
                              throws IOException
Returns image data suitable for posting to twitter.

Parameters:
context - The current context.
imagePath - The path to the image.
Returns:
A byte array containing the bytes to be posted.
Throws:
IOException

getImageForPost

public static byte[] getImageForPost(Activity context,
                                     Bitmap image,
                                     Bitmap.CompressFormat format)
                              throws IOException
Returns image data suitable for posting to twitter.

Parameters:
context - The current context.
image - The image to be compressed.
format - The compression format to use (one of JPEG or PNG).
Returns:
A byte array containing the bytes to be posted.
Throws:
IOException
